lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form into a knot or bow.

sentence.text: Two thick pieces of cord were tied horizontally and vertically around it .
Nick combed her hair and tied the ribbon himself , badly , too loosely .
His face was burnt dark by the sun , his raven-black hair tied in a knot at the back of his head .
On inward-opening casement windows attach sheers , fitted at the top and bottom on wire , and draw in the centre of each curtain with ribbon tied into bows .
She fiddled with the thread of the duvet , tying it over and over into little knots .
She wrapped her raincoat around her , tying the belt tightly .
After pulling up the curtain to the desired width , tie the cords neatly but do not cut them off .
A passing student doctor clipped and tied the umbilical cord for her , and told her the baby was a girl and just fine .
The butcher holds the head by the hair and deftly scalps it , then , tying the long black hair into a knot , he tosses it into the gully .
He tied his shoe laces , his feet on the chair .
Kelly tied her laces around the back of her heel to combat loose shoes but ended up with a rubbed Achilles tendon .
Tie the ribbon around the orange .
Tie some pretty ribbon around the parcel , ensuring that you leave the chosen area free .
Renwick bent to tie his shoelace , straightened up when the ambulance 's motor merged with the traffic outside .
Bend down and tie your shoelace .
She tied the strings of their aprons and did up their buttons , and she sat between them at their bread and milk breakfast which was at half past seven .
Fifteen of the monkeys had tied their tails into a giant knot and had to be anaesthetised while a vet took 20 minutes to undo it .
Claudia , who had taken off her sweater and tied the arms around her waist , now undid the knot and pulled the sweater on again .
Then tie the rope around her wrists .
And in her condition there was no way that she could have tied the rope around the beam , claimed prosecuting counsel , Rodney Klevan , QC .
I did n't see anything except a man tying a rope around the large upper branch of a tree .
He then tied electrical cable around the trunk and his neck before hanging himself .
` When I think the giant eel is biting on the ball , I 'll quickly tie the rope around this other hook inside the bucket .
But she was still smiling at me , so I just tied it in a knot and left it .
The Friar nodded and got to his feet , picked up his sack , put it down again , and finally tied the neck in a tight knot , looking a little shamefaced as he did it .
As he finished tying the cravat into an acceptable knot he saw that one of the cheese-knives had stuck to the table linen by virtue of the butter that had been left on it .
` You know , darling , " Louise said , as she was tying her scarf , ` you 're very unfair to yourself and your mother .
Sigarup passed a lukal , and Kalchu slung it over the ram 's back and tied the two sets of stings , one across the chest and the other round the hind legs and under the tail .
` I want you to do something for me , " I said , tying my tie .
Stok tied his tie , using all the muscles of his fingers as though it was made of metal instead of cloth .
I left the rifle , checked the War Bag and put its strap over my head , tying the waist-string quickly .
Next , long white streamers tied into an intricate pattern in the centre were handed to various women standing in the circle .
She wrapped her raincoat around her , tying the belt tightly .
